Package repository

Interface IRepository<ID,​T extends BaseEntity<ID>>

All Known Implementing Classes:
CatCSVRepository, CatFoodCSVRepository, CatFoodXMLRepository, CatXMLRepository, CSVRepository, CustomerCSVRepository, CustomerXMLRepository, FoodCSVRepository, FoodXMLRepository, InMemoryRepository, PersistentRepository, PurchaseCSVRepository, PurchaseXMLRepository, XMLRepository
public interface IRepository<ID,​T extends BaseEntity<ID>>

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.Optional<T> delete​(ID id)
    Removes the entity with the given id.
    java.lang.Iterable<T> findAll()  
    java.util.Optional<T> findOne​(ID id)
    Find the entity with the given id.
    java.util.Optional<T> save​(T entity)
    Saves the given entity.
    java.util.Optional<T> update​(T entity)
    Updates the given entity.

  • Method Details

    • findOne

      java.util.Optional<T> findOne​(ID id)
      Find the entity with the given id.
      Parameters:
      id - must be not null.
      Returns:
      an Optional encapsulating the entity with the given id.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given id is null.

    • findAll

      java.lang.Iterable<T> findAll()
      Returns:
      all entities.

    • save

      java.util.Optional<T> save​(T entity) throws ValidatorException
      Saves the given entity.
      Parameters:
      entity - must not be null.
      Returns:
      an Optional - null if the entity was saved otherwise (e.g. id already exists) returns the entity.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given entity is null.
      ValidatorException - if the entity is not valid.

    • delete

      java.util.Optional<T> delete​(ID id)
      Removes the entity with the given id.
      Parameters:
      id - must not be null.
      Returns:
      an Optional - null if there is no entity with the given id, otherwise the removed entity.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given id is null.

    • update

      java.util.Optional<T> update​(T entity) throws ValidatorException
      Updates the given entity.
      Parameters:
      entity - must not be null.
      Returns:
      an Optional - null if the entity was updated otherwise (e.g. id does not exist) returns the entity.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given entity is null.
      ValidatorException - if the entity is not valid.
